reviews.review_msg: Don't be deterred by the other ratings here. For 201, James was somewhat disinterested in the material and skipped by things quickly. That being said his exams were easy and related to the most obvious slides and study questions. 301 was a great class that I learned a lot in. James was very generous in marking and helpful throughout.

James was a really nice guy but seemed very uninterested in the course. He was using the slides and tests from another prof so the concepts emphasized in class were not necessarily emphasized on the exam. I gained more knowledge from my tutorial than I ever did in class so lectures felt pointless. We were only graded on exams so study constantly.

Despite his apparent knowledge of the content, he doesn't go in depth on the material that comes up on the exams and assignments. There's no textbook to refer to for this course when you're left clueless during assignments. Attend labs in order to gain a better understanding of the calculation questions.

A great teacher among the BPK department. He might have somewhat of a monotonous voice, however the lectures are very concise and clear themselves that make up for a rather lengthy lecture. All the questions were very fair and the expectations were not that high. If you can tolerate basic physics, this course is highly worth it with him!

I believe that this class had the potential to be amazing, but it ended up like hell, as I feel we barely had any practice questions for exams. As a result, I found the exams to be extremely difficult, as this class was basically physics, which requires lots of practice questions.

Tony is a bit all over the place, but I really enjoyed having him as a prof! He's funny, makes things interesting, and obviously loves what he teaches. Attendance is a must due to iclicker. Biomechanics is my favourite course I've taken to date!

I clickers for marks, midterms and finals are fair if you study all the practice questions he gives u (some are way harder than what he actually tests u on) and main theory concepts discussed in class. Mt1 is calculation heavy, mt2 is theory heavy, fin (cummulative) is combo of both. Assignments can be difficult but just ask the TA for help!!

Exams were straightforward and questions were taken directly from tutorials or his slides. Super easy. Tony is hilarious too, and is available for help outside of class so if you're struggling I recommend you email him or see him in office hours.
Great Prof! Explains the concepts well and super clear in the lectures. Don't need to cram much for the exams. overall class was pretty easy and fun
class is a joke. If you have any basic physics knowledge its an easy A+. Exams can be hard if you dont understand the concept of physics though so becareful!

Tony is able to deliver contents very concisely, even though every topic seems daunting at first. His exams are very fair, and he also has a ton of practice questions and problem sets which can ensure your success. His lectures are hilarious and he also gives out what is going to be on the midterms which is very helpful.

Tony's lectures seemed really easy but his exams were brutal. His explanations and demonstrations did not make sense. The first few weeks of lecture were very slow-paced but after the first midterm, he rushed through every topic. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS.

Tony is incredibly knowledgable about biomechanics. His course is organized and fair. Some topics can be hard and not as Intuitive but he provides every resource possible. He's caring and you can tell the material is part of his daily life, examples and explanations come to him naturally and lectures are super smooth. I enjoyed this course a lot!
